events.1862: Bombay High Court was established for Maharashtra, Goa, Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu territory. This court has benches at Nagpur, Panaji and Aurangabad.
events.1896: Gandhiji published "The Green Pamphlet" at Rajkot and then toured to Bombay, Madras, Poona and Calcutta educating Indians in regard to grievances of South African Indians.
events.1900: S. K. Patil, Congress leader, was born.
events.1920: Rushikesh Mulgaonkar, Air Chief Marshal (1976-78), was born.
events.1942: Usha Mehta, freedom fighter, started broadcasting from a secret transmitter on the wave length of 42.84 meters. This channel was used for freedom movement telecasts.
events.1947: Pakistan was partitioned from India. Gandhiji hailed the following day as one of rejoicing for deliverance from British bondage.
events.1954: 'State Carrom Association' was established in Mumbai.
events.1968: Pravin Kalyan Amre, cricketer (Indian batsman, century on Test debut 1992), was born in Bombay.
events.1987: A soldier in a guard of honor attacks Indian Prime Minister Gandhi with his rifle butt at Sri Lanka.
events.1993: New governors for MP, Bihar, West Bengal & Tripura.
events.1996: Amrit Rai, son of Munshi Premchand, died.
events.1997: Special session of Parliament to commemorate 50 years of independence.
events.1998: The Government transferred  Revenue Secretary N. K. Singh and  Finance Secretary Montek Singh Ahluwalia.
